noun.description: A charge wrongly levied or entered in an account.

verb.description: To charge an incorrect amount to (a person or organization).
To make a false or incorrect accusation against (a person or thing). Now rare.
Molecular Biology. To link (a molecule of transfer RNA) with the wrong amino acid.

origin: Late 18th century; earliest use found in Charlotte Smith (1749–1806), poet and novelist. From mis- + charge<br>late 15th century (in an earlier sense). From mis- + charge.
